Top 10 Most-Viewed SUNY Old Westbury Stories of 2019
National honors, successful students and faculty and happy graduates highlight the list of the most-viewed SUNY Old Westbury stories of 2019.
Students Participate in 19th Amendment Centennial Research Campaign
Students in the American Studies Department documented the lives of late 19th and early 20th century leaders of the suffrage movement as part of a nationwide effort.
College expands health careers partnership with SUNY Downstate to include Public Health
New agreement provides for priority consideration for graduates of Old Westbury’s degree in Health and Society for Downstate’s Master of Public Health and Master of Medical Informatics Programs.
Academic Advising available for all students

Old Westbury participates in federal, state and local aid programs that make our already affordable education even more so. The Office of Financial Aid is dedicated to providing high-quality, helpful service to every applicant. Their goal: Assist you in funding your college education.
Old Westbury, Long Island, New York
State University of New York at Old Westbury
Priority is given to those applicants who submit all documents by the following deadlines.
For most graduate programs entry for Fall admission is June 15th.
For most graduate programs with a Spring program entry, the deadline is November 15th.
Completed applications received after the deadline will be processed on a space available basis.
Graduate Application deadlines for the MS in Accounting and Taxation

NOTE: Due to state regulations concerning online education, students can only enroll in Old Westbury’s online M.S. in Accounting program if they reside in New York, Colorado, Hawaii, Indiana, Michigan, Montana, South Dakota, Virginia, or Wisconsin. If you have questions during the application process, please contact the Graduate Admissions team either by phone at 516-876-3200 or via email to

SUNY Old Westbury does not ask or consider your response to a criminal history question in the admissions decision process. However, please be aware that if you seek access to student housing, study abroad or internship opportunities, or professional licensure, you will be asked to provide this information at that time.
Old Westbury, Long Island, New York
State University of New York at Old Westbury
The best way to get to know Old Westbury is to visit!

With a wooded 604-acre campus centrally located on New York’s Long Island, Old Westbury offers the best of both worlds - a quiet atmosphere dedicated to learning yet just 22 miles (35 km) from the heart of New York City. Only you can determine the best fit for you.  A visit to campus will give you an up close and personal look at what the Old Westbury experience is really about.
Discover why students, faculty, and alumni love this place and value the time they spend here.

Campus tours are offered by the Office of Enrollment Services, which is located in the Campus Center, Room I-202. Tours are conducted by either a student ambassador or a member of the Admissions team.
About one hour in length, each tour enables you to visit the Student Union, see our classrooms, look into our Residence Halls, and explore our recreational facilities.
To schedule a campus tour please click the link below. Walk-in tours are not conducted. If you would like to schedule a group tour, please email us at
Old Westbury is located on a wooded 604-acrea campus on the north shore of Long Island and offers the best of both worlds:
A quiet atmosphere dedicated to learning:
all the advantages of suburban shopping and
a variety of recreational activities within a 10-minute drive. When it is time to concentrate on classes, the quiet campus atmosphere provides the ideal environment for studying.
22 miles from the greatest city in the world:

Located only 22 miles east of Times Square, Old Westbury offers access to the array of educational, cultural and social attractions of New York City. Whether on their own or as part of a campus trip, students can experience and explore New York City with ease.
Learn more on the Long Island and the Nassau County areas

SUNY College at Old Westbury is conveniently located immediately north of the Long Island Expressway (Route 495, exit 41N) in the village of Old Westbury, N.Y.  Its location in suburban Nassau County offers easy access by car, train, and bus.
